title: Ca(OH)2 - solubility in Ca(NO3)2, particle diagram

content.question:
Answer the following questions about the solubility of Ca(OH)2 (Ksp = 1.3 x 10-6 ) .

Write a balanced chemical equation for the dissolution of Ca(OH)2(s) in pure water.

Calculate the molar solubility of Ca(OH)2 in 0.10 M Ca(NO3)2 .

In the box below, complete a particle representation diagram that includes four water molecules with proper

orientation around the Ca2+ ion.

Represent water molecules as.

frqParts.text:
Answer the following questions about the solubility of Ca(OH)2 (Ksp = 1.3 x 10-6 ) .

Write a balanced chemical equation for the dissolution of Ca(OH)2(s) in pure water.

Calculate the molar solubility of Ca(OH)2 in 0.10 M Ca(NO3)2 .

In the box below, complete a particle representation diagram that includes four water molecules with proper

orientation around the Ca2+ ion.

Represent water molecules as.

skill.text: 3.C: Represent visually the relationship between the structures and interactions across multiple levels or scales (e.g., particulate to macroscopic).
